abstract: From DealBook’s Perks Watch: For the past two years, WellPoint has been paying office support for Larry C. Glasscock, its nonexecutive chairman, under an agreement negotiated in December 2005.
snippet: From DealBook’s Perks Watch: For the past two years, WellPoint has been paying office support for Larry C. Glasscock, its nonexecutive chairman, under an agreement negotiated in December 2005.
lead_paragraph: For the last two years, WellPoint, which was in the news on Monday for selling its pharmacy benefit management unit to Express Scripts for $4.7 billion, has been paying office support for Larry C. Glasscock, its nonexecutive chairman, under an agreement negotiated in December 2005.

headline.main: A Well-Stocked Office for WellPoint’s Chairman
